Front End

These are based on my confidence/proficiency in practical use, basically the rating is higher in tech where I struggle less.

Approach

I prioritize scalability, and leaner solutions. Tooling and build scripts optimize code prior to deployment or release. If applicable, I write code to be completely agnostic, such that we can iterate on the UI without having to re-deploy the Back End.

Experience

ATM Interface (E-Pass)

An in-person machine that takes cash and stores credit for prepaid highway toll fees. The interface runs on Webkit, the reason being the client wants to be able to update the system remotely without technicians on the field.

There are about a handful of unique views, and the user interaction is simple (touch, single-tap only) because of the hardware limitations. I used plain JavaScript and CSS animations triggered by attributes.

Status: Active, servicing a percentage of 75k users. This interface is in place in all of the client's ATMs.

Quart

A hosted markdown blogging platform and web-based text editor.

I used Backbone Routers, Views, and Models here. The text editor is a personally extended Ace Editor. The parts of speech highlighting and writing assistant is coded in by hand, tagging aided by a POS library. Templating is powered by Underscore.

Status: Shelved, the user base was small (80), and the cost to sustain was too much for a free app. I decided to make a similar service that was much more sustainable.

Lilii

A convention-based markdown blogging platform that is managed through Dropbox. Created as a more sustainable free service alternative to Quart, costing $0.18 per month at most on AWS.

The blog layout uses plain JavaScript for pagination and Typographic progressive enhancements, Hyphenator for smart hyphenation, Zepto for block-level commenting.

Brook

Brook is a linkboard heavily inspired by Hacker News and the Subreditting format. This is a practice in code brevity.

The platform is designed to respond to requests in under 500ms, as well as to scale fast on a single core. All modern libraries are dumped for plain JavaScript and CSS. It uses simple non-conventional solutions for communication to reduce code footprint.

Status: Active, this is an open source project, the codebase can be found here.

Others

Toppik is an E-Commerce retail site that runs on Magento, it uses Bootstrap for the responsive Grid Layout, and jQuery for the custom UI elements.
